text: Robert Guérin (28 June 1876 – 19 March 1952) was a French journalist. He was the 1st President and one of the founders of the Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA). On 23 May 1904, Guérin (then just 28 years old) was elected president and remained in his post for two years. Category:1876 births Category:1952 deaths Category:Presidents of FIFA
title: Robert Guérin
